results.title: Warlords and Widows the Maronites of Lebanon
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Everyman”.
This film focuses on the Maronites of Lebanon and is Part Two of a two-part investigation that explores the underlying beliefs, emotions and antagonisms that have resulted in the battles between the Christians and the Islamics of the Middle East.

results.title: Joining solid conductors
results.creator_credit: Visual Aids, US Office of Education
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Electrical Wiring”.
How to make the following joints: “Western Union”, pigtail, plain tap, wrapped tap (or Britannica), loop tap and fixture joints; how to use a blow-torch; how to flux and solder joints, and insulate them.

results.title: Everybody's business: management in action (NP)
results.creator_credit: Mark Davis, Open Learning Agency of Australia, Monash University and ABC-TV (Australia)
results.brief_description: Today the workplace is changing. Quantum changes in the world economy, in technology and in society itself have brought about a revolution in the nature of work. Increasing use of self-management strategies have led to a far greater sharing of management functions through the whole workforce. The classic functions of management - planning, organising, leading, and controlling are becoming everybody’s business, hence the title of this series. Throughout the series, reporter Cheryl Hall explores the new approaches to management in all sectors of the workforce. Kerry O’Brien speaks to experts on the key issues of management today.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Mark Davis, Open Learning Agency of Australia, Monash University and ABC-TV (Australia)

results.title: Management: the bottom line (NP)
results.creator_credit: Mark Davis, Open Learning Agency of Australia, Monash University and ABC-TV (Australia)
results.brief_description:
Episode number 13 of Series “Everybody’s business: management in action (NP)”.
Management must strive to achieve many outcomes. They are responsible to the organisation, the staff, the customer and society. Productivity improvement is their primary responsibility. However, this must be considered relative to the needs and wants of all the stakeholders. Meeting the needs and desires of all these people is often a very complex balancing act. How well it is carried out is a measure of the managers. This episode is likely to be a full scale debate among Australian managers, unionists, commentators, and employees about the role of management in the 1990’s.

results.title: The More things change (NP)
results.creator_credit: Mark Davis, Open Learning Agency of Australia, Monash University and ABC-TV (Australia)
results.brief_description:
Episode number 12 of Series “Everybody’s business: management in action (NP)”.
This episode looks at the pervasiveness of change, how to plan for change, why change is resisted and the relationship between learning and change. Change is a process that must begin with individuals.

results.title: Heaven's My Destination
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Everyman”.
Since returning from the moon many astronauts have testified to the strong spiritual impact the space experience has had on them. A number have committed themselves to Christ and Ed Mitchell has founded the Institute of Noetic Sciences. This program looks at how space travel has given these men a new perception of man’s place in the universe.

results.title: The Seventh Enemy
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Everyman”.
Based on the book of the same title the six elements in the global crisis are explained: The population explosion, starvation, disappearing natural resources, degradation of the environment, nuclear weapons and the power of science and technology. The real danger is the seventh enemy - the human factor of apathy and inertia which could result in a universal war between poor and rich nations
